intro: Cotyledon orbiculata var. spuria, commonly known as the woolly cotyledon, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are covered in a fine, white绒毛, giving it a soft, woolly appearance. The leaves are typically rounded and can vary in color from green to reddish-pink, depending on light exposure. It produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. This plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
